courses: PHYS 225 - Mathematical Methods for Physics and Engineering
PHYS 265 - Modeling and Simulation of Physical Systems

requirements.label: Additional Physics
requirements.subject: PHYS
requirements.notes: Two additional PHYS courses at the 200- or 300-level

requirements.label: Research/Thesis Option
courses: Three credits of research from PHYS 473 or 493 or 421 or 422 or 423

requirements.label: Additional Science
requirements.notes: Three additional credits chosen from biology, chemistry, computer science, engineering, earth and environmental geoscience, mathematics, or physics courses

requirements.label: Statistics: one of the following
courses: SOAN 218 - Basic Statistics in the Social Sciences

requirements.label: Five additional courses of 3 credits or more in politics, including completion of one of the following four sequences and including at least one 300-level seminar course, which entails an independent research and writing component
Additional Credits
requirements.subject: MIXED
requirements.notes: Six additional credits which must include courses from two of the following disciplines: cognitive and behavioral science, economics, history, philosophy, religion, or sociology and anthropology

requirements.label: Introduction
courses: REL 210 - Approaches to the Study of Religion
requirements.notes: Must be taken before the start of the senior year

requirements.label: Asian Religions
courses: REL 231 - Body and Soul in India

requirements.label: Christianity
courses: REL 250 - Truth, Belief, Dissent: Defining Insiders and Outsiders in Ancient, Medieval and Modern Religion

requirements.label: Islam
courses: REL 271 - Islam in America: Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of Happiness

requirements.label: Cluster
courses: A group of at least three courses proposed by students in consultation with their departmental adviser before the end of the junior year
Must include at least two courses from the Religion Department
May include up to three credits from one three- or four-credit course in other related disciplines

requirements.label: Additional Work
requirements.subject: REL
requirements.notes: Additional work in religion or other related disciplines to add up to 10 courses. A limit of one non-Religion course will count toward the major.

requirements.label: 200-level or above
requirements.subject: REL
requirements.notes: A minimum of 15 credits must be at the 200 level or above, excluding REL 210, 399, and 493

requirements.label: Notes
courses: Students seeking to graduate with honors are required to graduate with a minimum of 11 three- or four-credit courses
